title: Sloppy USMNT performances to blame as U.S. loses yet another Gold Cup final to Mexico
content: The USMNT's first chance to win a trophy under coach Mauricio Pochettino slipped away as it played poorly against Mexico in the Gold Cup final.

title: Nats seek 'fresh approach,' fire Martinez, Rizzo
content: Headed into an off day and stuck in last place in the NL East, the Washington Nationals fired manager Dave Martinez and general manager Mike Rizzo on Sunday night, hours after a 6-4 loss at home completed a sweep by the Boston Red Sox.

title: Durant to Rockets part of NBA-first 7-team trade
content: A series of moves going back to Kevin Durant's trade to the Houston Rockets before the draft ultimately became the first seven-team trade in NBA history.

title: Poch: USMNT Gold Cup lessons 'priceless, painful'
content: United States coach Maurico Pochettino said his team had learned "priceless" lessons despite a "painful" 2-1 loss to rival Mexico during Sunday's Gold Cup final.

title: Rollins agrees to 3-year deal to return to Bucks
content: Free agent guard Ryan Rollins has agreed to a three-year, $12 million deal to return to the Milwaukee Bucks.

title: Kershaw gets special ASG invite; no Soto, Betts
content: The MLB All-Star Game rosters will feature 19 first-timers -- and special commissioner's pick Clayton Kershaw -- as the pitchers and reserves were announced Sunday.

title: Sources: Nuggets expect Valanciunas to honor deal
content: The Denver Nuggets have informed Jonas Valanciunas ' representatives that the franchise fully expects the center to honor his contract, sources said.

title: Two-time champ Alonso declines HR Derby invite
content: Two-time champ Pete Alonso of the Mets told reporters Sunday that he will skip the Home Run Derby in Atlanta, adding, "I have never really fully enjoyed the three off days, so I just want to be in the best possible position to help this team win."

title: Pirates CF Cruz makes 105.2 mph throw to plate
content: Pirates center fielder Oneil Cruz made a 105.2 mph throw to nab Seattle's J.P. Crawford at the plate on Sunday, the second-hardest thrown ball to produce an outfield assist since Statcast started tracking in 2015.

title: üèà Fantasy football sleepers, busts and breakouts
content: Which players will surprise, disappoint or make a big jump this fantasy season? Our analysts give their picks.

title: All-Star rosters: Biggest snubs and other takeaways
content: Some of the game's biggest names are headed to Atlanta, but some deserving stars will be watching from home.

title: The most obscure MLB All-Stars ever
content: Hunter Goodman just became an All-Star -- not the first time an unfamiliar player is headed to Midsummer Classic.

title: What Nationals' overhaul means for their No. 1 draft pick and trade deadline plans
content: Washington fired its GM and manager as draft and trade season heat up. Here's how the fallout could play out.

title: Remembering Ruffian 50 years after her breakdown at Belmont
content: The filly shattered her right front ankle in a match race against Kentucky Derby winner Foolish Pleasure.

title: First-half MVPs for all 30 MLB teams
content: The stars (and storylines) so far, plus how each club's playoff hopes have risen -- or fallen -- this past month.

title: After a week of upsets, which Americans are still playing at Wimbledon?
content: Wimbledon has been brutal for the top seeds, but Ben Shelton and Emma Navarro are among those who remain in the draw

title: Los Angeles Sparks troll Sophie Cunningham's comments on Detroit, Cleveland after win
content: Earlier in the week, the Indiana Fever guard said she didn't know how excited players would be to play in two of the WNBA's three latest expansion cities.

title: Three rookies, five first-time honorees highlight All-Star roster
content: Indiana and Seattle each put three players on the All-Star Game roster, which also includes a trio of rookies.

title: USC Paralympian Ezra Frech is a pioneer under pressure
content: The two-time gold medalist is the first above-the-knee amputee recruited to a D-I track and field program.

title: Lando Norris on British GP final lap: Don't mess it up
content: As Lando Norris closed in on home victory at the British Grand Prix, he had one overriding thought in his head: "Just don't f--- it up."

title: Musiala fractures left leg in Donnarumma collision
content: Bayern Munich said Jamal Musiala faces a "lengthy" recovery from a left leg fracture after his collision with PSG goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma.

title: Mart√≠n Zubimendi joins Arsenal from Sociedad
content: Arsenal have completed the signing of highly rated Spain midfielder Mart√≠n Zubimendi from Real Sociedad, the Premier League club have announced.

title: Spain on favourites tag: 'Don't mention that word'
content: Spain defender Olga Carmona said there is no mention of the word favourites as they prepare to face Belgium in the European Championship on Monday.

title: Norway on brink of Euros QF after Finland win
content: A late solo strike by Norway forward Caroline Graham Hansen secured a 2-1 victory against Finland in the Women's European Championship on Sunday, as the twice champions took a big step towards qualifying for the quarterfinals.

title: Neuer criticizes Donnarumma after Musiala injury
content: Bayern Munich goalkeeper Manuel Neuer criticized his PSG counterpart Gianluigi Donnarumma after Jamal Musiala suffered an apparent serious injury.

title: Santi hopes to 'make fun' of Pulisic after GC final
content: Mexico striker Santiago Gimenez has plenty of motivation going into Sunday's Gold Cup final against the United States.

title: Madrid's Gonzalo living a 'dream' at CWC
content: Real Madrid forward Gonzalo Garc√≠a said he is a living a "dream" at the FIFA Club World Cup after earning comparisons to the club's legendary former striker, Raul, with four goals in five games for Los Blancos.

title: Gonzalo Garc√≠a proves he can be the reason Real Madrid win Club World Cup
content: With Real Madrid in the semifinals of the Club World Cup, the performances from youngster Gonzalo Garc√≠a could be the reason they go all the way.

title: The four biggest lessons of free agency's first wave
content: Why did so many players simply re-sign instead of exploring the market? Here are 2025's hottest hockey trends.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Hosts Switzerland keep knockout hopes alive
content: Switzerland's win over Iceland has them on course for the knockouts. Here's what else you need to know from Euro 2025 action.

title: From New York to Michigan: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 2 quiz
content: You say you're a fan, but how well do you know your state sports trivia? Cue our second "state check" of the summer.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona told price to sign Rafael Le√£o
content: Barcelona have been told what they will need to pay to sign Rafael Le√£o from AC Milan. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer window weekly: Gy√∂keres close to Arsenal? Chelsea, City to trim squad?
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Meet the 2026 recruits who remind us of some big NBA players
content: Projecting high school talent isn't an exact science, but it's easier when they remind us of NBA stars at that age.

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Darshan case rerun? Bengaluru youth stripped, thrashed for sending obscene messages to minor girl
content: In Bengaluru, eight individuals were apprehended for kidnapping and assaulting a youth who allegedly threatened to reveal a minor girl's past relationships to her family. The victim and the girl were previously in a relationship, and after their separation, he threatened to expose her affairs.

title: Drunk, shirtless MNS leader‚Äôs son abuses woman, flaunts father's clout
content: Raj Thackeray's MNS faced criticism after a video surfaced showing an MNS leader's son, Rahil Shaikh, verbally abusing a Marathi-speaking woman following a car accident. Rahil, allegedly intoxicated, flaunted his father's political connections during the incident. Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Nirupam questioned MNS's commitment to Marathi pride in light of the event.

title: 'Centre handicapped': VP questions why no FIR against Justice Varma in cash row
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar highlighted the constraints faced by the government in registering an FIR in the Justice Yashwant Varma case, citing a decades-old judicial order.

title: 'Happy' to play with CSK captain, Prithvi Shaw joins Maharashtra - details inside
content: Prithvi Shaw is set to represent Maharashtra in the upcoming 2025/26 domestic season, securing a no-objection certificate from Mumbai. Shaw expressed gratitude to the Mumbai Cricket Association, citing the move as crucial for his growth. He looks forward to joining talents like Ruturaj Gaikwad and believes Maharashtra's progressive cricketing infrastructure will positively impact his career.

title: China goes off rail after PM Modi wishes Dalai Lama on his b'day
content: China has lodged a formal protest with India following Prime Minister Modi's birthday greetings to the Dalai Lama and the attendance of Indian officials at his 90th birthday celebrations. Beijing views the Dalai Lama as a separatist and accuses India of interfering in its internal affairs.

title: Tesla board urged to question Elon Musk by former DOGE adviser
content: Former DOGE advisor James Fishback is critical of Elon Musk's decision to form the America Party, citing concerns about Musk's focus on Tesla. Fishback's firm, Azoria Partners, has postponed the launch of its Tesla ETF due to potential conflicts with Musk's CEO responsibilities. US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent also suggested Musk should prioritize his companies over political endeavors.

title: Astronaut Shukla speaks to Isro chief; gives big update on ISS experiments
content: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, currently on the ISS as part of the Axiom-4 mission, spoke with Isro chairman V Narayanan on July 6, 2025, about his health, mission progress, and scientific work. Shukla's observations and inputs are expected to significantly contribute to the Gaganyaan mission. Isro continues to provide mission support, with regular interactions with standby astronaut Prashant Balan Nair.

title: Chess | ‚ÄòCarlsen‚Äôs respect for Gukesh is only going to grow‚Äô ‚Äì What does it even mean?
content: Magnus Carlsen secured victory at the Super United Rapid and Blitz in Croatia, overshadowing reigning World Champion Gukesh Dommaraju. Despite Carlsen's recent criticisms and subtle jabs towards Gukesh's abilities, the young challenger has consistently responded with strong performances on the board. This rivalry marks a significant transition in world chess, reminiscent of Carlsen's own rise to challenge established legends.

title: 'India's minorities are hostages': Owaisi slams Rijiju over 'benefits' claim
content: Asaduddin Owaisi has strongly criticized Kiren Rijiju's claim that minorities in India receive more benefits than the majority. Owaisi refuted this statement, highlighting the discrimination and violence faced by Muslims, including instances of lynching, property demolitions, and hate speech.

title: GitHub CEO: 'Smartest' firms will hire more software engineers, not fewer
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke suggests that companies leveraging AI effectively will increase developer hiring to capitalize on AI-driven productivity gains. He argues AI serves as a multiplier for engineering talent, making developers more efficient and creating demand for skilled professionals. Dohmke dismisses the idea that AI alone can build successful businesses without substantial coding knowledge.

title: Setback for Celebi: HC junks Turkish firm's plea over airport security clearance
content: The Delhi High Court upheld the revocation of Turkey-based √áelebi's security clearance by the BCAS, citing national security concerns. This decision followed intelligence inputs suggesting √áelebi's operations posed a risk, particularly given geopolitical tensions. √áelebi, responsible for ground handling at several Indian airports, argued the revocation violated natural justice, but the court sided with the government's assessment of an 'unprecedented' threat.

title: Musk posts 'arrest counter' of Epstein case; fresh dig at Trump?
content: Elon Musk posted an "arrest counter" on X, highlighting zero arrests in the Jeffrey Epstein case, seemingly targeting Donald Trump. This follows reports that the DOJ and FBI found no evidence Epstein was murdered or blackmailed powerful figures. Musk previously alleged Trump's name appears in sealed documents related to the case.

title: All-party MPs forum writes Centre to confer Dalai Lama with Bharat Ratna
content: Indian MPs from various parties are backing the Dalai Lama. They want him to receive the Bharat Ratna. The MPs also want him to address the Parliament. They oppose China's interference in Tibetan spiritual matters. The forum supports a pro-Tibet bill. They are also pushing for better amenities for Tibetan settlements. This action highlights India's ongoing diplomatic challenge with China.

title: Infosys HR notice: IT giant sends 'detailed warning email' to employees
content: Infosys is sending personalized warnings to employees exceeding standard work hours, a move contrasting founder Narayana Murthy's call for a 70-hour workweek. The company's automated system tracks remote work, alerting employees working beyond 9 hours and 15 minutes daily. This policy shift prioritizes employee well-being and work-life balance amidst health concerns in the IT sector.

title: TN TRB result 2024 declared: Final answer key, scorecard released for 1,768 teacher posts
content: Tamil Nadu Teachers Recruitment Board released the Secondary Grade Teacher Exam results. The exam was held on July 21, 2024. It aimed to fill 1,768 teacher vacancies. Candidates can check results on trb.tn.gov.in. The board also published the final answer key. Shortlisted candidates will undergo certificate verification. The board will announce the verification dates soon.

title: IND vs ENG: He is not going to be a Kohli type character - Ex-England captain
content: Nasser Hussain lauded Shubman Gill's captaincy following India's massive victory at Edgbaston, leveling the Test series. Hussain noted Gill's visible leadership, contrasting it with perceived ambiguity in previous matches. He highlighted Gill's calm demeanor and tactical decisions, such as Akash Deep's bowling arrangement, which proved effective. Hussain emphasized that Gill's primary responsibility is scoring runs, which he has accomplished successfully.

title: Pak honours Kargil 'hero' it once disowned; had refused to accept body in 1999
content: Pakistan's army chief honored Captain Karnal Sher Khan, a Kargil war "martyr," despite initially refusing to accept his body after it was found on Tiger Hill. India stated that Pakistan denied acknowledging its army's involvement in Kargil, refusing to identify Khan to conceal their role and disservice the families of their soldiers.

title: Russell Wilson‚Äôs wife Ciara celebrates his Marvel debut
content: Ciara supports Russell Wilson as his clothing label, 3BRAND, appears in Marvel's Ironheart. The brand made its TV debut in the Disney+ series. Wilson shared his excitement on social media. Ciara also expressed her pride. 3BRAND's appearance raises its profile in fashion and entertainment. The couple's business bond continues to grow. Their influence has now reached a global superhero stage.

title: 'Boosted momentum': Pirate Software as Stop Killing Games hits 1 million signatures
content: The Stop Killing Games petition surpassed a million signatures, fueled by an unexpected twist. Pirate Software's criticism sparked a social media backlash, ironically boosting the movement as supporters rallied against his perceived villain narrative. Despite his claims of minimal impact, the controversy surrounding his stance unified SKG advocates, injecting fresh energy into the campaign.

title: Was Yung Miami warning Cardi B the whole time? Stefon Diggs drama explodes online
content: Cardi B has removed all traces of Stefon Diggs from her Instagram account. This action has fueled speculation about a breakup. Fans are recalling a past warning from Yung Miami. Miami had previously labeled Diggs a "hoe" in a tweet. This tweet is now seen as a warning to Cardi B. Cardi B and Diggs were rumored to be dating. Fans believe Cardi B ignored red flags. The internet is buzzing with theories about the split. Some suggest Diggs was a rebound after Offset. The situation remains unconfirmed. Fans are closely watching for further developments.

title: Hailee Steinfeld finds peace at home as Trubisky gives Josh Allen added security
content: The Buffalo Bills have re-signed veteran quarterback Mitchell Trubisky to bolster their quarterback depth behind Josh Allen, providing crucial insurance for the team's Super Bowl aspirations. Allen's partnership with Hailee Steinfeld remains strong, with their wedding celebrated by teammates, including Trubisky. This move brings stability and peace of mind as Allen aims to bring the Lombardi Trophy to Buffalo.

title: 'Tariffs being used as tool of coercion': China responds to Trump‚Äôs threat to Brics
content: China has firmly responded to President Trump's threat of additional tariffs on BRICS nations, asserting that such measures are unproductive and serve no constructive purpose. Beijing emphasized that the BRICS bloc is dedicated to cooperation and inclusive global development, rejecting confrontation and geopolitical rivalry. The Chinese Foreign Ministry reiterated its opposition to using tariffs as a tool for political coercion.

title: Hindi row: Why Uddhav Sena has distanced itself from Stalin's hardline stance?
content: Following a rare show of unity against "Hindi imposition," Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin sought support from Uddhav Thackeray. However, Shiv Sena (UBT) distanced itself from DMK's radical stance, clarifying their opposition is against forced imposition, not the language itself. With BMC elections approaching, BJP aims to consolidate North Indian voters in Mumbai.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Very tempting to play Kuldeep, but ...': Gill explains selection call
content: Shubman Gill explained Washington Sundar's inclusion over Kuldeep Yadav was to strengthen batting depth, a decision vindicated by Sundar's all-round performance in India's historic Edgbaston win. Gill highlighted the importance of spin in controlling the game when the Dukes ball softens, and his aggressive strategies during England's innings. He dismissed the Edgbaston jinx, crediting dedicated Test preparation for his form.

title: 10-min delivery: Cost of convenience & what happens when discounts vanish
content: Quick commerce platforms like Swiggy Instamart and Blinkit are facing consumer pushback due to rising fees, including handling, delivery, and surge charges. This is prompting shoppers to compare prices with local vendors and plan purchases to avoid extra costs.

title: BJP says Chirag Paswan's LJP will contest as ally in Bihar; Cong's 'weather scientist' dig
content: Chirag Paswan's announcement to field LJP candidates for all 243 Bihar seats has stirred reactions. BJP interprets Paswan's move as contesting within the NDA, anticipating a united front. Conversely, Congress predicts Paswan's departure from the NDA post-election, foreseeing a BJP defeat under Nitish Kumar's leadership. LJP's past performance highlights its potential to influence election outcomes, particularly impacting JD(U) prospects.

title: Hoping for a US H-1B visa? Trump administration's stringent scrutiny likely
content: Indian H-1B visa aspirants should brace for potential challenges under Donald Trump's second term, experts warn. Anticipate increased rejection rates, mirroring trends from his initial presidency, alongside extended processing times and more rigorous documentation requests.

title: WTC: India open account with record Edgbaston win; Australia top early standings
content: Shubman Gill's captaincy led India to a dominant 336-run victory over England at Edgbaston, marking their first win in the ongoing five-match Test series and earning them 12 WTC points. This victory, India's biggest-ever away Test win, levels the series at 1-1. Australia currently lead the WTC standings with a perfect PCT, while India and England are joint-third.

title: What‚Äôs bigger than an anaconda? This 58-million-year-old fossil may have the answer
content: Fossil remains unearthed in Colombia's Cerrej√≥n coal mine reveal Titanoboa cerrejonensis, the largest snake ever discovered, dating back 58 million years. This colossal serpent, reaching up to 14 meters and weighing over a tonne, thrived in a hot, swampy rainforest. Its discovery provides invaluable insights into reptilian evolution, ancient tropical ecosystems, and the climate conditions of the Paleocene Epoch.

title: 'They asked me to raze house': PMAY glitch forces 80 y/o widow to live under tree
content: Gaura Bai, an 80-year-old widow from Madhya Pradesh, faces homelessness due to a software glitch in the PM Awas Yojna. After being instructed to demolish her mud house in anticipation of a new one, she and her family have been living under a tree for ten months.

title: 5 homemade drinks that may help manage blood sugar naturally
content: For those seeking natural ways to manage blood sugar, certain traditional drinks may offer subtle support. Fenugreek seed water, warm cinnamon water, and karela juice are believed to aid insulin function and glucose absorption. Amla water, rich in vitamin C, may support pancreatic health, while an aloe vera and tulsi drink could soothe the gut and balance blood glucose.

title: Bilawal Bhutto's extradition 'offer': Hafiz Saeed‚Äôs son fumes; LeT lashes out
content: Bilawal Bhutto's offer to extradite Pakistani terrorists to India has sparked outrage, particularly from Talha Saeed, son of Lashkar-e-Taiba chief Hafiz Saeed. Talha condemned Bhutto's remarks as an "irresponsible offer," demanding instead the extradition of Indian leaders and accusing Bhutto's family of aligning with Western and Indian narratives against Pakistan.

title: IND v ENG: 'I'd be worried ...': Broad's stern warning for England ahead of Lord's Test
content: India secured a massive win against England, leveling the series 1-1. The third Test shifts to Lord's. Stuart Broad highlights India's potent bowling attack, especially with Jasprit Bumrah's return. Shubman Gill's team is confident after their Edgbaston triumph. England focuses on strengthening their pace options. All eyes are on how England will counter India's revitalized pace attack.

title: Earn above Rs 12 lakh? Top 5 ways to make your retirement plan tax-efficient
content: The tax treatment of many retirement products has changed in recent years. Find out how to get past these changes to make your nest egg tax efficient.

title: IND vs ENG: 'India too good, but ‚Ä¶' - Vaughan stands by 3-1 England prediction
content: Despite India's commanding 336-run victory at Edgbaston, levelling the five-match series 1-1, Michael Vaughan maintains his pre-series prediction of a 3-1 win for England. Vaughan criticised England's regression and reliance on fortune, while Stuart Broad highlighted the threat of India's bowling attack, urging England to reassess before the Lord's Test.

title: Telangana factory tragedy: Toll rises to 42 at Sigachi; 8 still missing
content: The Sigachi Industries blast death toll has tragically climbed to 42 with the passing of Jitendra Kumar and the identification of Chikkan Singh through DNA analysis. Eight individuals remain missing following the devastating incident. Out of the 33 initially injured, 14 have been discharged, while 18 are still receiving medical care in various city hospitals, as confirmed by Sigachi Industries.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Be in love with the grind': Gill's post sums up India's historic win
content: Shubman Gill's stellar batting performance, including becoming the first batter to score 250 and 150 in the same match, and Akash Deep's 10-wicket haul powered India to a record-breaking 336-run victory over England at Edgbaston. Gill's captaincy debut marked India's first win at the venue since 1967, leveling the series 1-1.

title: Aamir Khan names Vishnu Vishal and Jwala Gutta‚Äôs newborn daughter Mira
content: Tamil actor Vishnu Vishal and his wife, ace badminton player and Arjuna awardee Jwala Gutta, have revealed the name of their newborn daughter, Mira. The couple, who welcomed their baby girl on April 22, held a special naming ceremony in Hyderabad that was graced by Bollywood superstar Aamir Khan. What made the occasion even more special was that Aamir didn‚Äôt just attend the event, he named the baby.

title: Airlines alarmed by DCGA's new medical test rule for pilots
content: India's DGCA has mandated that commercial pilots undergo medical tests exclusively at Indian Air Force centers, raising concerns among airlines. This decision, prompted by a cardiac arrest incident, aims to prevent falsified medical records.

title: Scientists discover a 'second Earth' twice the size of our planet near a red dwarf star
content: In a groundbreaking discovery, astronomers have identified TOI-1846 b, a super-Earth exoplanet located 154 light-years away. This planet, nearly twice Earth's size, orbits a red dwarf star and exhibits a potentially water-rich composition. Although its high temperature precludes habitability, TOI-1846 b offers valuable insights into the formation of rocky planets.

title: Bihar voter list row: Oppn vs EC intensifies; SC to hear pleas against SIR
content: The Supreme Court has agreed to an early hearing on petitions challenging the Election Commission's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, scheduled for Thursday. Opposition parties RJD and Congress, along with the Association for Democratic Reforms, argue the revision could disenfranchise lakhs, particularly marginalized communities, due to strict citizenship documentation requirements within a short timeframe.

title: Maha security scare: Suspicious boat spotted off Raigad coast; cops on alert
content: A suspicious boat, potentially a Pakistani fishing vessel, was detected near Maharashtra's Raigad coast, triggering a large-scale search operation involving multiple security agencies. Heightened coastal surveillance and security measures have been implemented due to concerns arising from the region's history, particularly the 2008 Mumbai terror attacks.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Deserves that smile' - Shastri lauds Gambhir as India's bold call pays off
content: Ravi Shastri questioned resting Jasprit Bumrah for the Edgbaston Test, but India's bowlers, led by Akash Deep and Mohammed Siraj, secured a historic win. Gautam Gambhir's team management saw their bold selection calls vindicated as India leveled the series 1-1. Shubman Gill praised Akash Deep's performance, confirming Bumrah's return for the Lord's Test.

title: Bank holiday for Muharram 2025: Are banks open or closed today?
content: Bank Holiday for Muharram 2025: There was uncertainty about banking services on July 7, 2025, due to confusion over the Muharram holiday. The official government calendar stated Muharram was on July 6, 2025. Therefore, banks are open on July 7.

title: Mars in just 15 years? European Space Agency‚Äôs bold plan
content: The European Space Agency (ESA) has revealed an ambitious plan to establish human settlements on Mars within 15 years. ESA's vision includes self-sustaining habitats, AI-driven farming, and in-space manufacturing, aiming to create a solar system economy. While challenges remain, ESA believes collaboration and technological advancements could make this multi-planetary dream a reality by 2040.

title: 'Any country aligning with anti-American policies of Brics ... ': Trump's warning
content: Donald Trump threatened Brics nations with an additional 10% tariff for aligning with what he termed "anti-American policies," following India's signing of a Brics declaration condemning US tariff measures. He announced the delivery of tariff letters to various countries and previously threatened 100% tariffs if Brics moved to replace the US dollar.

title: Delhi HC rejects Turkish firm‚Äôs plea against revocation of security clearance
content: The Bureau of Civil Aviation Safety (BCAS) on May 15 revoked the security clearance of the firms just days after Turkiye backed Pakistan and condemned India‚Äôs strikes on terror camps in the neighbouring country

title: CPI(M) urges Chief Minister to intervene in the mango farmers‚Äô crisis in Chittoor
content: The government had earlier assured the mango farmers a price of ‚Çπ12 per kg ‚Äî ‚Çπ4 to be provided as a subsidy by the State, and the remaining ‚Çπ8 from pulp industry owners, CPI(M) leader pointed out

content: CPI State secretary says Kerala society ‚Äòwill not accept‚Äô Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar who ‚Äòstudied in an RSS-run school and became an ideological propagator of the organisation‚Äô

title: Kaladan project between India, Myanmar to be operational by 2027: Sonowal
content: The Minister said that the Northeastern region will play a critical role in reviving the economic prosperity of India

title: Rahul accuses Modi govt of making rich richer, questions its silence on F&O manipulation
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi accused Modi Govt of turning a blind eye to the revelation and wondered if there were more players rigging the market

title: Indian astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla dials ISRO officials from International Space Station
content: ISRO said that the Indian astronaut expressed his heartfelt gratitude to Prime Minister Narendra Modi for providing him this incredible opportunity to represent India on the ISS

title: All State-run hostels in Tamil Nadu to be renamed ‚ÄòSocial Justice Hostels‚Äô: CM Stalin
content: The decision to rename State-run hostels followed recommendations made by a committee led by retired Madras High Court judge K. Chandru, constituted to advise the government on measures to eliminate caste and racial differences among students in educational institutions

title: Andhra Pradesh Government approves Amaravati Quantum Valley Declaration
content: Secretary (IT, Electronics & Communications) Bhaskar Katamneni stated in the G.O. Ms.No.23 that the government organised the Amaravati Quantum Valley Workshop on June 30 as landmark initiative

title: Rahul Gandhi to visit Patna on July 9, will join protests over electoral rolls revision, labour code
content: Gandhi will join the protesters in the State capital, where a march has been proposed to the office of the Election Commission

title: Kerala braces for two-day transport disruption with private bus strike on Tuesday, general strike on Wednesday
content: Private bus owners across Kerala have also warned of an indefinite strike from July 22 if government fails to address their long-pending demands

title: Social Justice Ministry seeks additional allocation for overseas scholarship
content: 2025-26 NOS scheme, 66 selected candidates told to wait ‚Äòsubject to availability of funds‚Äô, officials say allocation not enough considering continuing payments to students who are continuing their studies

title: Visakhapatnam Port All Trade Unions JAC leaders demand abolition of Labour Codes
content: The Port JAC leaders sought implementation of the Major Ports Wage Agreement made in September 2024 and withdrawal of the Major Port Authorities Amendment Bill, 2025

title: Akhilesh Yadav vows full support to RJD in Bihar Polls
content: Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav asserted that the BJP‚Äôs ‚Äúscams‚Äù in Uttar Pradesh will be exposed during the campaign for the upcoming Bihar Assembly polls

title: Counterfeit currency racket busted in Andhra Pradesh; 10 arrested
content: Vayalpadu circle inspector J Prasad Babu got specific information about the counterfeit currency gang moving around Vayalpadu Cross on the Madanapalle - Bengaluru main road

title: Census data will be available early, residents can self-enumerate: Registrar General of India
content: The first digital Census and will be conducted in two phases and ‚Äúfor the first time technology will be used to collect data and send it electronically to the central server‚Äù

title: Four brothers arrested for brutal murder of lorry driver in Andhra‚Äôs Kurnool
content: Police took the four accused into custody near Venkanna Baavi in the village on Sunday evening and produced them before a court on Monday

title: Bank trade unions to join strike on July 9
content: The strike is expected to be observed by more than 15 crore workers in all industries to protest ‚Äúpro-corporate economic reforms and anti-labour policies of the central government‚Äù

title: Madras High Court dismisses case against 181 grounds of T.N. Congress Committee land in Chennai
content: Justice Abdul Quddhose records the submission of a private company that it had lost possession of the property during the pendency of the case

title: Journalist harassed in road rage incident in Bengaluru
content: The police tracked down the accused with the help of the car‚Äôs registration number, which was provided by the complainant, but the man reportedly refused to come to the police station

title: Kerala Crime Branch questioned Union Minister Suresh Gopi as part of Thrissur Pooram ‚Äòdisruption‚Äô probe
content: However, Crime Branch officials say the agency preferred to keep the time or where they questioned¬†Suresh Gopi confidential for now, given the politically sensitive nature of the probe

title: Preamble like parenthood, cannot be changed 'howsoever you try': Vice President
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar says ‚ÄòPreamble of our Constitution was changed at a time when hundreds of people were behind the bars, the darkest era of our democracy ‚Äì the Emergency era. Fundamental rights were totally suspended. You need to examine it‚Äô

title: BJP protests against Kerala govt‚Äôs ‚Äòdismantling‚Äô of public health sector for private hospital interests

title: South Calcutta Law College, where student was gang-raped, reopens

title: Union Minister Gadkari says World War could ‚Äòbreak out anytime‚Äô, flays superpowers‚Äô authoritarianism
content: The technological advancements pertaining to war were also making it tougher to protect humanity, he asserted.

title: Producers of hit film Manjummel Boys turn up for questioning before police in cheating case
content: Interrogation in connection with alleged denial of principal amount and profit share to an investor in the movie

content: Since the onset of monsoon, Himachal Pradesh has reported 78 deaths, of which 50 were linked to rain-related incidents such as cloudbursts, flash floods and landslips

title: Clash during Muharram procession: Prohibitory Orders imposed in Jharkhand‚Äôs Palhe village
content: At least three persons were injured in the clash that took place in Palhe village in the Patan police station area on July 6

title: T.N. CM Stalin to visit Cuddalore on July 14
content: According to official sources, the Chief Minister will launch the first camp of the ‚ÄòUngaludan Stalin‚Äô (Stalin with you) initiative on July 15 in Chidambaram Municipality¬†

title: World Bank report: Congress terms government assertion on India being among ‚Äòmost equal‚Äô countries as ‚Äòfraudulent‚Äô
content: The Congress demanded that the Press Information Bureau must clarify as to the origins of this press release and retract it immediately

title: Suspicious boat spotted near Raigad Coast in Maharashtra, security stepped up
content: Prima facie, the vessel is suspected to bear markings of another country and may have drifted to the Raigad coast, an official said

title: Supreme Court to hear on July 10 pleas challenging Special Intensive Revision in Bihar
content: RJD MP Manoj Jha, TMC MP Mahua Moitra and activist Yogendra Yadav were among the petitioners against the ECI‚Äôs Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in poll-bound Bihar

title: Attacks on Hindi-speaking people: BJP leader draws Pahalgam parallel to target Thackeray cousins
content: Last week, MNS workers damaged the glass door of Mumbai-based share market investor Sushil Kedia's office in Worli after he declared he would not speak Marathi

title: Thousands witness grand consecration of Tiruchendur Subramanya Swamy temple after 16 years
content: Conducted¬†between 6:15 a.m. and 6:50 a.m. on Monday, the ceremony, organised by the HR&CE department after a gap of 16 years, drew devotees in large numbers from across Tamil Nadu

title: Twist in Pune techie 'rape' case: Complaint was false and misleading, say police
content: The case took a dramatic turn after the investigation revealed that the 'delivery agent' was the friend of the woman who visited the flat with her consent

title: Decapitated Torso Of Man Found In Madhya Pradesh, Human Sacrifice Suspected
content: A shocking incident has been reported from Madhya Pradesh's Tikamgarh district as a decapitated torso of a man was found along with a coconut, a lemon, and salty snacks, leaving suspicion of 'human sacrifice', a police officer said.

title: 15 Tamil Nadu Fishermen Return From Iran, Efforts On To Rescue Others
content: A group of 15 Tamil Nadu fishermen who were stranded in Iran following the Iran-Israel war have returned safely to Chennai.

title: Citizens Will Now Be Able To Self-Enumerate During Upcoming Census
content: A special dedicated web portal will be launched for self-enumeration during the upcoming Census, which will be available for both phases of the national enumeration exercise, officials said Monday.

title: Video: Drunk, Half-Naked MNS Leader's Son Abuses Woman Speaking Marathi
content: Amid the language controversy in Maharashtra and instances of Raj Thackeray's supporters thrashing non-Marathi speakers, a video has emerged embarrassing the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS).

title: Forest Rangers Feared Elephant Won't Accept Separated Calf. They Did This
content: A two-month-old elephant calf that got separated from its herd in Assam's Kaziranga National Park has finally been reunited with its mother.

title: 3 Dead, Flight Ops Suspended Amid Rain Fury In Nagaland
content: At least three people have died in Nagaland due to incessant rain for the past few days causing heavy flooding across the state.

title: Planned C-Section Births Linked To Higher Risk Of Leukaemia: Study
content: Having a planned caesarean section during delivery could be related to an increased risk of leukaemia -- a blood cancer -- later in the child's life, compared with an emergency C-section, a study has found.

title: Turkish Firm Celebi's Plea Challenging Security Clearance Revocation Dismissed
content: Celebi's security clearance was revoked days after Turkey supported Pakistan during Operation Sindoor.

title: After Trump's Tariff Threat, China Says BRICS 'Not Seeking Confrontation'
content: Donald Trump pressurised a further 10 percent tariff on countries aligning themselves with the emerging BRICS nations, accusing them of "anti-Americanism".

title: Akhilesh Yadav Vows "Full Support" To Lalu Yadav's Party In Bihar Polls
content: Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav on Monday said his party will extend full support to Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) in the upcoming Bihar Assembly polls.

title: BMI May Influence Breast Cancer Risk In Women With Heart Disease: WHO
content: Excess weight may increase the risk of developing breast cancer among postmenopausal women with cardiovascular disease, according to a study by the World Health Organisation (WHO), published on Monday.

title: This State Is First To Implement Tuberculosis Death Prediction Model
content: Tamil Nadu has become the first state in the country to implement a model which predicts the probability of deaths among adults with Tuberculosis and has integrated it with the existing state-wide application TB SeWA, which triages them at diagnosis.

title: Nearly 1,600 Earthquakes Hit Japan In 3 Weeks, Dozens Of People Evacuated
content: Since June 21, the area has experienced as of early Monday what seismologists refer to as a swarm of 1,582 quakes.

title: "Tomorrow Some Other Community...": Court On Slaughter Ban During Jain Festival
content: The Bombay High Court on Monday wondered if it can prohibit slaughter of animals during the nine-day 'Paryushan Parv' of the Jain community and whether such an order would open the floodgates with other communities also seeking similar bans during th

title: Rahul Gandhi To Join Patna Protest Over Labour Code On July 9
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will be in Patna on Wednesday for a "chakka jam" against the new labour code and special intensive revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, leaders of the INDIA bloc said.

title: "Drive Me Out": Bhojpuri Actor Nirahua Dares Thackeray Cousins Amid Marathi Row
content: Uddhav and Raj Thackeray shared a stage after nearly 20 years for the cause of the Marathi language and vowed to oppose the "imposition" of Hindi in Maharashtra.

title: July 9 Or August 1: When Will Trump's "Reciprocal" Tariffs Take Effect
content: While the Trump administration in the United States is prepping to send letters to Washington's trading partners, dictating new tariffs, confusion persists over when the pause on President Donald Trump's reciprocal tariffs will be lifted.

title: Australian Cop, Who Shot Dead An Indigenous Teen In 2019, Was A Racist
content: The killing of 19-year-old Kumanjayi Walker by then-Police Constable Zachary Rolfe in the remote Northern Territory community of Yuendumu sparked protests and renewed scrutiny of Australia's treatment of its First Nations people.

title: Minor Bihar Boy Killed, Father Injured In Firing While They Were Asleep
content: Unidentified assailants shot at a man and killed his 12-year-old son while they were sleeping in the verandah of their house in the Mahalgonj area of Araria district, said police.

title: Haridwar Police Seize Drugs Worth Rs 3 Crore Ahead Of Kanwar Yatra
content: Haridwar Police arrested a youth with a large consignment of illegal drugs worth around Rs 3 crore, days before the Kanwar Yatra begins.

title: Over 8,600 pilgrims leave Jammu base camp for Amarnath Yatra in sixth batch
content: There is a huge rush at the counters for on-the-spot registration, with authorities increasing the number of counters as well as the daily quota to ease the rush

title: Kunwar Anand Singh, former MP and father of MoS Kirti Vardhan Singh, passes away
content: Kunwar Anand Singh was elected to the Uttar Pradesh Assembly in 1964, 1967, and 1969. He was elected to the Lok Sabha from Gonda in 1971, and again in 1980, 1984, and 1989

content: Mr. Jaishankar, during his meeting with Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov, discussed bilateral cooperation, West Asia, BRICS and the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO)

title: Lokesh lauds teachers for enrolling their children in government schools

Kar Medical College and Hospital created a nationwide outrage, another allegation of sexual assault inside a law college has shaken the people of Kolkata once more.¬†Moyurie Som, Shrabana Chatterjee,¬†and¬†Shiv Sahay Singh¬†look at how safe women in West Bengal‚Äôs Capital feel, in the city with India‚Äôs lowest reported crime against women for some years now

title: NHL free agency tracker: Updated list of the summer signings

title: Piastri penalty: Did stewards' inconsistency cost him British GP win?
content: Oscar Piastri has claimed his first ever victory at the British Grand Prix . he responded to countless questions about the 10-second penalty that cost him victory . but he refused to elaborate on the true feelings no doubt seething inside . his ebullient teammate, race winner lando norris, had to wait alone for 25 minutes .

title: Messi's brilliant brace helps Miami rout Montreal
content: Inter Miami beat CF Montreal 4-1 in their first MLS game in over a month . Lionel Messi scored twice to help the hosts to a 4-1 win . the hosts were eliminated last week in a 4-0 defeat to Paris saint-Germain .

title: PSG adapt to adversity to oust Bayern Munich at Club World Cup
content: Paris Saint Germain beat Bayern Munich 2-0 in club world cup semifinals . champions league holders PSG come face-to-face with the 2024-25 Bundesliga champions in new york . despite two red cards, 2-0 victory could have been the final at the MetLife Stadium on July 13 . the semifinals could be the final of the match at the metlife stadium .

title: NBA free agency: LeBron's next move, Denver's deals, more intel

title: Belgium's record scorer Wullaert ready to lead from the front vs. Spain

title: One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: this year's deadline is going to be complicated . only eight teams are more than five games out of a wild card . it might make for a slow deadline if all those clubs remain in contention by the end of July .

"the Mets have kind of turned the corner from being that little cousin or little brother or sister," says showalter . they have followed parallel paths so far this season .
